bill_title: revise the membership on the Board of Economic Development.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the membership on the Board of Economic Development. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 1-16G-1 be amended to read as follows: 1-16G-1. There is created a Board of Economic Development and the Governor may appoint up to thirteen members to consult with and advise the Governor and the Governor's commissioner for economic development in carrying out the functions of the office. The members of the the board shall be appointed by the Governor for four-year terms of office so arranged that no more that than four members' terms expire in any given year. Not all members may be from the same political party. At least three members shall be farmers or ranchers who are actively engaged in farming or ranching, at least one member shall work in an agricultural lending institution, and at least one member shall own or work in an agricultural business. The Governor shall designate the terms at the time of appointment. Any member appointed to fill a vacancy arising from other than the natural expiration of a term shall serve only the unexpired portion of the term. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
